isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLIES

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the left and right countershaft assemblies are identical and disassembled in the same manner.

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the front of each countershaft ( Figure 188).

figure.caption: Figure 187. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring From Each Countershaft Front

step1.para: Use the rear face of the 3rd speed gear as a base and press the drive gear, PTO gear, and 3rd speed (or overdrive) gear from each countershaft ( left, Figure 189). This removes the front bearing inner race from the countershafts of models so equipped ( right, Figure 189).

figure.caption: Figure 188. Press Drive Gear, PTO Gear, and 3rd Speed Gear From Countershaft, and Remove Front Bearing Inner Race

important.para: NEVER USE THE PTO GEAR AS A PRESSING BASE. The narrow face width of this gear makes it very susceptible to breakage.

figure.caption: Figure 189. Press 2nd Speed and 1st Speed Gears From Each Countershaft

note.para: Always use caution when pressing a cluster of gears from the countershaft. It is necessary to press these gears off in a cluster of three and, then, in a cluster of two.

step1.para: If necessary, remove the keys and roll pin from the countershaft ( Figure 191).

figure.caption: Figure 190. Remove Keys and Roll Pin From Countershaft
